quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Last week I gave a fire safety talk. [clears throat] And nobody paid any attention.  It's my own fault for using PowerPoint.  PowerPoint is boring.  People learn in a lot of different ways, but experience is the best teacher.  [lights a cigarette] Today, smoking is gonna save lives. [throws cigarette into garbage can filled with paper and lighter fluid]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [looking around office to see if anyone notices the smoke]  Does anyone smell anything smoky?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Did you bring your jerky in again?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [clears throat]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [points to smoke] Oh, my God! Uh, Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Whoa, fire!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, fire!  Oh my goodness!  What's the procedure?  What do we do, people?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: The phones are dead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, how did that happen?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: It's out in the hall.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, we don't know that.  The smoke could be coming through an air duct.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh my God! Okay, it happening.  Everybody stay calm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What's the procedure, everyone? What's the procedure?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Stay [bleep] calm!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, wait, wait.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everyone, now [bleep] calm down!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! No, Michael! No!  Touch the handle.  If it's hot, there could be a fire in the hallway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What does warm mean?

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [groaning] Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Not a viable option.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Try a different door.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, what's next?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't run.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh! Here's a door.  Check that one out. How's the handle?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It-- it's warm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, uh, another option. [everyone chattering at once]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Back door.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Back to our options. Jeez! Ok! settle down everyone.  No bunching!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh! I forgot my purse.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Leave it woman!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Get out of the way! Go, go, go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Things can be replaced, Phyllis! People, human lives, however, can...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Ah! My hand!  That's hot!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Aah! This ones hot too!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, we're trapped.  Everyone for himself.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [shouting] Out of my way! Let's go. Get out of my way!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Calm, please

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Get out of the way!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Have you ever seen a burn victim?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Move it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay! Procedure, procedure. Exit options.  Where do we go folks?  Wha-- Use a what to cover the mouth?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [pulling cat out of filing drawer] It's okay.  Shh shhh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: A what?  A rag.  A damp rag, perhaps.  Let's remember those procedures.  What are the options?  Okay, that's the wrong way.  We've already tried that.  Remember your exit points.  Exit points people.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What's next?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oscar!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Stay alive!  I'm getting help!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Pull me up!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You're too heavy!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I only weigh 82 pounds!  Uh-- save Bandit! [throws cat into air duct and he falls out through the other side] Oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How about 911?  Anyone? 911. [Michael throws a chair at the window, Kevin smashes a chair through the vending machine and begins to grab snacks, everyone is shouting.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What do we do?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Use the surge of fear and adrenaline to sharpen your decision-making.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, I am not dying here.  Come on. [everyone is coughing from the smoke, Dwight lights some fire crackers and they start popping]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What is that?  What is that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: The fire's shooting at us!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What in the name of God is going on?!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes! [Dwight pulls fire alarm] Yes, ba-- Yes, battering ram! Battering ram!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis and Creed
quotes.line: Ahhhh!!! [Oscar's leg crashes through the ceiling]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Go, go, go, go, go!! [Andy and Jim ram the door with the copy machine]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [throws the projector out the window] Help!! Help!!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm about to die!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [blowing air horn] Attention everyone! Employees of Dunder Mifflin!  This has been a test of our emergency preparedness.  There is no fire.  It was only a simulation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Fire not real.  This was merely a training exercise. [Oscar drops down from the ceiling] So, what have we learned? [Stanley falls to the floor]  Oh come on.  It's not real Stanley. Don't have a heart attack.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no! You will not die! Stanley! Stanley! You will not die!  Stanley! Stanley! Barack is president!  You are black, Stanley! I'm gonna give him mouth to mouth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, no, no! Don't give him mouth to mouth for this!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: He's going to swallow is tongue.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. Michael. Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Open your mouth.  Come on. Don't swallow it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [everyone shouting at once] Michael! Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Leave me al--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You're choking him!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Saving him!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: How could you possibly think this is a good idea?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: A lot of ideas were not appreciated in their time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Electricity.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Shampoo.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: You could have burned down the whole building.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I just want to say for the record, I did not kill anyone.  Stanley was attacked by his own heart. And he should be released from the hospital and back in the office in a couple days.

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.line: Did you shout, "Fire!", causing a panic?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes I shouted "fire!".  I shouted many things! I also shouted instructions on how to get out of the building, so you can imagine my frustration as safety officer when nobody would heed of what-- heeded--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hed. Hedded

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: When no one hedded--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Take hedded of.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: N-no one would take hedded of my instructions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Heed. Heed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So, you--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Take heed of.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And, well, I don't see my co-workers--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Take heed of.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hee-heeding this right now.

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.line: Wh--what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. [walks to the window, sighs] This city.  Dwight. We are not mad, we are just disappointed.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: No, we are mad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes. We are. We are livid.  But we are going to let this one slide.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: No, we're not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am not a mind reader, David.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Look, this is very serious offense.  We have cause to fire you.

quotes.speaker: Michel
quotes.line: Can you shove down?  Instead... shove down, please.  Instead, what I think we should do is strip of your title as safety officer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And we should take a part of his pay and donate it the charity of your choice.  Something that Dwight doesn't like.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: PETA.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Michael, you have to take responsibility here. One of your employees had a heart attack.  He could have died, because of the way that you are allowing your office to run.  Do you want that on your conscious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You talking to me?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well... I guess we papered over that pretty nicely. [chuckles] It always amuses me when corporate thinks they can make some big change with a twenty minute meeting in some fancy high-rise. What's the matter? You hungry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs] No, Dwight.  I am worried.  A man's life is in my hands.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don't you worry about that.  I got it covered.  Okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I am planning a bomb scare that should really get the blood pumping.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's not gonna happen. I'm taking over as safety man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What? You?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm a smart guy.  I'll figure it out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's preposterous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nobody should have to go to work thinking, "Oh, this is the place that I might die today."  That's what a hospital is for. An office is for not dying.  An office is a place to live life to the fullest, to the max, to... An office is a place where dreams come true.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shhh! Don't excite him. Don't make him excitable. [whispering] Welcome back, Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Thank you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It's true. Around this office, in the past, I have been a little abrupt with people...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [flashback] Not maybe. Yes or no.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [flashback] No way. Uh-uh.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [flashback] Are you from another planet?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [flashback] Boy, have you lost your mind? 'Cause I'll help you find it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [flashback] Did I stutter?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [flashback] I'm done. Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: But the doctor said if I can't find a new way to relate more positively to my surroundings I'm going to die.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [in a British accent] A throne for your highness.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm not sitting in a wheelchair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no. No debate. You are going to sit in that wheelchair until you are back on your feet.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm going to die.

quotes.speaker: CPR trainer
quotes.line: A-B-C. Okay?  And hat stands for... airway, breathing and circulation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, you know what? That could be a little confusing, because in sales A-B-C means "always be closing."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is a farce. I should be teaching this course.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shut it.  Shut it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We found ourselves on the less prepared side of things when Stanley had his... when his heart went berserk. And I knew exactly what to do, but in a much more real sense I had no idea what to do.  So I thought we should have CPR training class and of course you can't get the practice dummy unless the instructor comes along with it. Red Cross, you know, racket.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [giving chest compressions to the practice dummy] I can't keep doing this forever.

quotes.speaker: CPR Trainer
quotes.line: It's been 20 seconds.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Call it.

quotes.speaker: CPR Trainer
quotes.line: Would you like to try next?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Absolutely I would not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know who I really think should go? Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: That's not a good idea, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: He needs to rest.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No rest for the sick. We are not always going to be there to coddle your heart back when it disappears to be working.  What are you gonna do if you're by yourself and your heart stops?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I would die.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And you're okay with that?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm okay with the logic of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh-uh.  No, no, no.  Come on. Get up.  Let's do this.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Yes. I had a heart attack.  I would quit, but I'm too old to find another job and I don't have enough saved to retire.  I feel like I'm working in my own casket.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on Stanley.  You're losing you.  You're losing you. Do it!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is you we're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, okay.  I'll show them. Here we go. [whispers] Stanley.  All right.

quotes.speaker: CPR Trainer
quotes.line: So, assessing the situation.  Are they breathing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, Rose. They are not breathing.  And they have no arms or legs.

quotes.speaker: Rose
quotes.line: No, that's not part of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Where are they?  You know what? If we come across somebody with no arms or legs do we bother resuscitating them? I mean, what kind of quality of life do we have there?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I would want to live with no legs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How about no arms? No arms or legs is basically how you exist right now, Kevin. You don't do anything.

quotes.speaker: Rose
quotes.line: All right, well, lets get back to it. 'Cause you're losing him. Okay, too fast. Everyone, we need to pump at a pace of a 100 beats per minute .

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: okay, that's uh, hard to keep track.  How many is that per hour?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How's that gonna help you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I will divide and then count to it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Rose
quotes.line: Okay. Well, a good trick is to pump to the tune of 'Staying Alive' by the Bee Gees.  Do you know that song?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, yes I do.  I love that song. [clears throat, begins to sing] First I was afraid, I was petrified.

quotes.speaker: Rose
quotes.line: No, it's--Ah, Ah, Ah, Ah, stayin' alive, stayin' alive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, I got it.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [to Rose] You were in the parking lot earlier. That's how I know you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, Ah, Ah, Ah, stayin' alive, stayin' alive [Andy joins in] Ah, Ah, Ah, Ah, stayin' alive, stayin' alive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, Ah, Ah, Ah...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh you can tell by the way I use my walk I'm a woman's man, no time to talk. Music loud, women warm, been kicked around since I was born. Oh, it's alright, it's okay, [Michael and Kelly join in] you can look the other way. Loo do do!

quotes.speaker: Rose
quotes.line: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Da, da, da, da, da, da, da

quotes.speaker: Rose
quotes.line: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [muttering] Stayin' alive, stayin' alive.

quotes.speaker: Rose
quotes.line: Yeah, okay.  You didn't maintain 100 beats per minute, and the ambulance didn't arrive because nobody called 911. So you lost him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, he's dead.  Anyone know what we do next? Anybody? Rose?

quotes.speaker: Rose
quotes.line: I have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Anyone else?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: We bury him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wrong. Ehh. Check for an organ donor card.  If he has one, we only have minutes to harvest.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: He has no wallet, I checked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: He is an organ donor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get me some ice and a styrofoam bucket. [pulls out knife from holder that is attached to his leg] Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh my God! Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What are you-- [people are yelling] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We search for the organs. Where's the heart? The precious heart.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm not feeling well.  I need to sit down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh my God! [Dwight has cut the face off the CPR dummy and put it over his own]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Clarice?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Could you tell me why you had to cut the face off the dummy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I didn't think it was very realistic in the movie and it turns out, it's pretty realistic.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: We had to pay for it.  Cost us thirty five hundred dollars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Five thousand three hundred dollars for a dummy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, look. David, this is why we have training.  We start with the dummy, and we learn from our mistakes. And now Dwight knows not to cut the face off of a real person.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hope you brought your appetitos.  My lady. My tuna. A little movie popcorn. [dumps popcorn in bowl, it's almost all seeds] Uh, damn it.  This movie, a lot of buzz.  Not coming out for another six months.  Mrs. Albert Hannaday. So, friendship with the Nard-dog has its privileges.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We don't normally download films illegally.  Because we're honest,  hardworking people.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And we don't know how.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: But Andy does, so we have to watch it with him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Punishment fits the crime.

quotes.speaker: Jessica Alba
quotes.line: [movie] I want you to meet my nana.  Nana...

quotes.speaker: Lily
quotes.line: Mmmhmm...

quotes.speaker: Jessica Alba
quotes.line: This is Sam.

quotes.speaker: Sam
quotes.line: Hi. Nice to meet you Mrs. Hannaday.

quotes.speaker: Lily
quotes.line: Please-- Call me Lily. [light chuckle] Let's play Bridge.  You can be my partner.

quotes.speaker: Sam
quotes.line: Alright... Lily.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [after Pam checks her cell phone] What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, no one really knows, but Pam's parents are going through a little bit of a rough patch in their marriage.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: My dad spent the night at our place last night.  My parents have been fighting for weeks and... it kinda sucks.  Jim's been great. But I'm gonna need to buy my dad a robe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He's not saying what he needs to say.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hmm? Who? Sam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I mean, they just need to communicate, you know?  If they said to each other what they're saying to everyone else, then--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Jim and Pam are, like, movie geniuses. They're catching things that are totally going over my head.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hi, everyone.  Corporate has given Dwight two strikes. They are very, very upset with him. So, as a disciplinary measure he is going to have to issue a formal apology. Dwight, have you prepared your statement of regret?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Let's hear it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [clears throat] "I state my regret."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You couldn't of memorized that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I could not, because I do not feel it. Okay, everyone. I am going to need you to sign this statement of regret as an acknowledgement that you heard it.  Okay? Everyone come on up here. It's not a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It is a big deal. You almost killed Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, right. I filled him full of butter and sugar for 50 years and forced him not to exercise. Now, take a lesson from Stanley and jog on up here and sign this, okay?  Make a line. Just form a line right here.  Sign it!  Sign it now!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi dad. Yeah Jim has shaving cream, check our bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Lily
quotes.line: [movie] I'm in here.

quotes.speaker: Sam
quotes.line: I uh, I'm sorry I didn't uh, realize you were in a bath.  Do you want me to go?

quotes.speaker: Lily
quotes.line: I want you to stay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Gimme a break.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I know it man. You know, Lilly was supposed to be Nicole Kidman, um and it was gonna be Sophie's mom, not grandmother. But then Nicole kidman dropped out so they went with Lily, with a small rewrite.

quotes.speaker: Sam
quotes.line: [movie] Get that in there. Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Lily
quotes.line: Get that done already.

quotes.speaker: Sam
quotes.line: I know but if I get it in deeper...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to Pam] Can you believe this? [pause] He was pretty talkative at breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah... but... eh... breakfast? You mean when they were eating soup? I don't think that was breakfast. Unless soup, does soup symbolize breakfast?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So he doesn't share it with his daughter but he shares it with his daughter's fiance?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You guys, they're making out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um, did my dad say anything about my mom?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mmm... nope, we mostly just talked about cereal.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I dunno. I mean, maybe he'll talk to you about some of this stuff 'cause he can't really talk to me about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mmm...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You're good to talk to.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [laughs] I'm ok, I'm not, great, and um... [nods]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [in a monk-impression tone] Ohmmm... Ohmmm... Everybody sit on the floor Indian style like me. [Meredtih sits Indian style in a dress exposing herself right in front of Michael] Ohmmm my God if you're wearing a dress please keep your knees together nobody wants to see that ohmmm... ohmmm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: My goal is to make this office as peaceful a place for Stanley Hudson as I can. I think sounds have a lot to do with that. Here are some downloaded peaceful sounds. [a couple of sounds play on the computer] That one makes me think... of death. It's kinda nice...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [everyone is lying on the floor in the conference room with the light off, Michael is walking around with a candle in his hand] It is a beautiful, sunny day as we walk through the meadow that is very spiritual and relaxing and there are flowers and it is sunny and beautiful. Now, up ahead, a castle, in a distance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Don't open your eyes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What? [opens her eyes, Michael is standing over her] Oh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And you walk up toward the castle, and inside the castle are 4 men, and each of them, none of them have shoes, and they give you a funny cigarette, and you feel even more relaxed, and then you want ice cream. You want a big bowl of ice cream. What kind do you want? Shout it out.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Chunky monkey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Too expensive.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Chocolate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Racism is dead Stanley, you can have any kind of ice cream you want. What do you want? [beeping starts] What is that? People! Please I told you to get rid of the cell phones.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It's my bio-feedback machine..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, ok. What is that, like, a video game?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It alerts me when my stress level goes up so I can try to calm down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You have stress?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Yes...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: During our relaxation exercise?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Let me get you some water.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No no, I'll help you. I'll help you up. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No, Michael, No. [beeping speeds up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Let me getcha.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Would ya, would ya step back please

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, alright.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Please. A little further.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. [beeping slows down]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: That's better. [Michael walks back towards Stanley and the beeping goes up again]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok... I think that thing is on the fritz. Ahh... Oscar, would you reach over and touch his thing? That's what HE said! Right guys, 'cause of gay? [Oscar has Stanley's monitor now] Let's give this a shot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hellloo... [beeping speeds up as Michael gets closer]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael, I think you're what's stressing everybody out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So... it wasn't Dwight after all. Looks like I am the killer. You never expect that you're the killer... it's uh... great twist. Great twist.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin this is Pam. Oh, hey Mom. No, what did Dad say?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What did you say to my dad?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: After you talked, he called my mom and said he was gonna look for an apartment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh my God. Pam, I don't know, I, nothing, truly, nothing. I mean, I, I just was honest with him and I, I'm so sorry, I don't know. I'll call him again. [Pam rolls her eyes and walks away]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Fifty percent of marriages end in divorce, so... it was her parents or my parents...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What could Jim have said to make my dad want to leave my mom? And at what point in our marriage is he gonna say it to me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't get it. Do I stress you out?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Nothing stresses me out. Except having to seek the approval of my inferiors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Speaking of which... [hands Michael the paper to sign for Dwight's formal apology]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Remember when people used to say boss, when they were describing something that was really cool like, those shoulder pads are really boss man... Look at that perm, that perm is so boss. It's what made me want to become a boss. And I looked so good in a perm and shoulder pads. But now, boss is just slang for jerk in charge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok everybody, I've figured it out. The reason that you are all so stressed around me is that you are too intimidated to tell me what you really think. [Jim shakes his head at the camera] You are keeping these feelings inside, and that is what's causing stress. So, what is the solution? Solution is honesty, laughter, and comedy. In short...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: A vacation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What? No. No, I am talking about a roast! Of Michael Scott! Oh c'mon! Who here has the Comedy Central Roast channel? You've seen it right? Everybody gets together, and everyone starts hurling insults at the one guy, and everybody's laughing, and everybody's hugging each other...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael are you serious? You really want us to roast you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Si senor.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: That's offensive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's not! It's not offensive during a roast! Anything goes! I want you guys to really get crackin on this. I want you to take me down. Don't hold back. I want you to really make fun of anything about me. It could be my race, could be the fact that I'm so fit, or I'm a womanizer... fair game. Whatever. I don't want to write your stuff for you, but I just want it to be good.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [giggling] Oh my GOD... Oh man... Ohhhhh my God...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I consider myself a good person. But I'm gonna try to make him cry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I can already feel people's stress starting to melt. I think they're very excited about paying their respects this way. I have got to make sure that YouTube comes down to tape this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: May I have your attention please? Sign in, sign in on the sign in sheet, the clipboard. This meeting is mandatory, if you do not sign in your name will not be counted. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hey, this is your apology letter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That was the last signature I needed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whoo!! Welcome welcome welcome welcome welcome. You are all jerks. Just kidding, not yet anyway. Welcome to the roast of Mr. Michael Scott. If you're here for the Grabowski wedding, it is the second door on the left. [Creed looks around] So, we all know how these work, needs to get crazy, take your best shot. I am going to sit right here on my chair and... ah... whoever wants to come up and roast me, you may. [Angela jumps up] Ok... lower the mic for the midget.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: If you ever wondered if you were Michael Scott, here's a quiz to help. If you ever put sunblock on a window, you might be Michael Scott. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I normally don't enjoy making people laugh. [grin]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: If you ever called the fire department 'cause your head was stuck in your chair you might be...

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.line: Michael Scott! [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey Hey, I don't go make burgers where you work and then tell you how to make burgers. Ha ha!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I have made a list of people that I would make out with before I would make out with Michael Scott. A turtle, a fridge, anybody from the warehouse, a woodchipper, Kevin, a candle, and Lord Voldemort. Anyway, Happy Birthday Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're so lucky! Good one... [clapping]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Michael? You ran over me with your car. You posted a picture of my bare boobs on the bulletin board with a caption that said "Gross"...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Michael, you are the reason I drink. You are the reason I live to forget.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pow pow pow... [hands making gunshot impression, sporadic clapping]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [yelling at Michael in Spanish]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Toby tries to come on stage] NO! No, friends only. Friends ONLY. [Toby shrugs and sits back down]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Several times a day, Michael says words that are way beyond my vocabulary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know where this is goin'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do ya?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok. Remember Spider face?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: OK. 'Cause the quote was, cut off your nose to spiderface.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Spite her - ok [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah... yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How dare you all attack him like this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, stop it Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael is your superior.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No no no no no no!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, you should be bowing down in front of him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight your'e supposed to do it this way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok, no, they don't understand who they have...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That is the way you're supposed to do it, idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're interrupting me. I'm trying to get your back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Idiot. Idiot! Idiot. Idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are you calling me an idiot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don't you ever talk to me that way. You pathetic, short little man. You don't have any friends, or any family, or any land. [clapping and whooing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well I just want to take a minute to talk to you all about something very serious. Once every hour, someone is involved in an internet scam. That man is Michael Scott. [laughter] He's supporting about 20 Nigerian princesses.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, ya know what? Forgive me for caring. Right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, ya know, Michael is a great delegator. He never does any work himself. Ever. And one time, I walked in on him naked, and his thing is so small. [quickly walks off stage] If it were an iPod it would be a shuffle! [clapping, laughter]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Can I make just a little announcement. In a professional roast, usually the roaster will say something nice about the roastee after they're done, something about how much they love them, so, just, keep that in mind.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Mike claims, we're all a family isn't that right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We are, we are a family.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Ok, so um, what's his name? All the way in the back there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh very funny.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: What's his name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uhh... hehe hah! I'm thinking Roy?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Roy left years ago. What's his name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't believe I have had the pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Warehouse Michael
quotes.line: Michael I gave you a ride home last week, we spent an hour in traffic...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: What's his name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jefferson.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Nope. His name is Michael. [Michael makes the da dum ksch on the drumset again]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [singing and playing the guitar] What I hate about you, you really suck as a boss, you're the laziest, jerkiest and you're dumber than applesauce. We're stuck listening to you all day, Stanley tried to die just to get away, heeey, well it's true. That's what I hate about you. That's what I hate about you. Yeah. And now, a man that deserves no introduction, Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Haha ha. Thank you very much, thank you. That was great. Great job, great laughs. Really, really went after my intelligence there. [clears throat] Dozens of online IQ test might prove you wrong, but, and my thing isn't tiny, its average, so... get your facts straight. [clears throat again] So when I heard that there was going to be a roast in my honor, I thought [choking up, clears throat again] sorry. [laughs nervously] I think I have a frog in my throat. Um... [sigh] I decided to jot down some quick thoughts about you people, um, first up Phyllis and Kevin. Uh um... [Michael walks off stage, knocking over the snare drum]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin this is Pam. Uh, I'm sorry, Michael's not here right now can I take a message? Great. I will. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's very unusual for Michael not to show up to work. My guess? He's either deeply depressed, or an icicle has snapped off his roof and impaled his brain. He has this terrible habit of standing directly underneath them and staring up at them. And I always say Michael, take two steps back, and stare at the icicle from the side. And he's like no, I like the way they look from standing directly underneath them.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [in the lunch room, with a sock puppet] He is so dumb that he tries to put his M&Ms in alphabetical order. [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Alright Kevin. Enough with the Michael jokes. I think he got it bad enough yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'm almost done.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: That reeks, and I'm trying to eat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Attention everyone I just got a text from Michael. He says personnel day. Are we hiring?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yep. You're being replaced.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I think he meant personal day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, that's quite a leap Pam.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I hope he's ok, I feel bad.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Give it up, he's dead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: He just sent a text...

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: What's a text?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [at a park throwing whole pieces of bread] Caw... caw... caw caw... caw...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know sometimes, to get perspective, I like to think about a spaceman on a star incredibly far away. And, our problems don't matter to him, because we're just a distant point of light. But he feels sorry for me, because he has an incredibly powerful microscope, and he can see my face. [looks towards the sky] I'm okay. No, I'm not.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Phyllis there's a package for you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, ok. [Phyllis signs for the package, opens an empty box]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [after snatching the clipboard with her signature] Got it.

quotes.speaker: Lily
quotes.line: [movie] Sam, Sam Sam. It's not that you dumped my granddaughter, and its not that you want children. It, it's that you lied to me. Can't you see that? Can't you see? Oh, I can never trust you. [Andy looks like he's going to cry]

quotes.speaker: Sam
quotes.line: Lilly no. Lilly! Lilly please! Lilly STOP! I don't care how much time we have left. I don't care what my friends say! And I don't care what your mom thinks! Frankly I'm pretty sure she's not makin any sense. Please. Move back to my apartment. [Andy's crying, "I'm All Out of Love" starts playing] Lilly. I'm not giving up. I'm not giving up. Lilly... Lilly! Push the reverse button! Reverse the button!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [through tears] Sam! Sam!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey Dad. No I know, Mom told me. Ok. Yeah I'll see ya then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So what did he say? Was it my fault?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. He said that you told him how much you love me. About how you feel when I walk in a room, and about how, you've never doubted for a second that I'm the woman you want to spend the rest of your life with. I guess he's never felt that with my mom, even at their best.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. [they hug]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: When you're a kid you assume your parents are soul mates. My kids are gonna be right about that. I guess it also means that sometimes love affairs look different to the people inside them. [Andy is in the background, looks incredulous]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I am not insightful enough to be a movie critic. Mm... maybe I could be a food critic. These muffins taste bad. Hmm, or an art critic. That painting is bad.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael! It's really good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey. Why are you wearing a turtleneck?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are you alright?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael, I feel like I was a little harsh yesterday. [murmurs of agreement]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I um, I spent the afternoon in the park trying to feed the pigeons, I guess they all flew west for the winter, and I, I just had some thoughts that I wanted to share with you people.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well I wrote them down so I wouldn't forget. Jim, you're 6'11 and you weigh 90 pounds, Gumby has a better body than you. Boom. Roasted. Dwight, you're a kiss ass. Boom. Roasted. Pam, you failed art school. Boom. Roasted. Meredith, you've slept with so many guys you're starting to look like one. Boom. Roasted. Kevin, I can't decide between a fat joke and a dumb joke. Boom. Roasted. Creed, you're teeth called, your breath stinks. Boom. Roasted. Angela where's Angela? [Angela raises her hand] Whoa there you are, I didn't see you there behind that grain of rice. Boom. Roasted. Stanley, you crush your wife during sex and your heart sucks. Boom. Roasted. Oscar, you are... [Stanley is laughing] Oscar, you're gay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Andy, Cornell called, they think you suck. And you're gayer than Oscar. Boom. Roasted. [Stanley is still laughing] Alright. Alright everybody, you know I kid, you know I kid. You guys are the reason I went into the paper business, so, uh, goodnight, God bless, God bless America, and get home safe. [clapping and murmurs of appreciation]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: They say that laughter is the best medicine so Stanley, you can throw away those pills. You are cured. Actually, you should... better hold onto  them pills, just in case.
